fields.description:
I found something very annoying while trying to do imports from FogBugz. 

When you enter the FogBugz connection information (database URL, login name, password, and driver name), the information keeps going back to default values.  I thought this information would be saved away somewhere so we didn't have to constantly re-enter it. But it wasn't.

I thought maybe it was a property. I searched and searched and couldn't find anything. 

Since we were having so much trouble importing issues from FogBugz, this was very annoying because we had to keep putting it in over and over and over again.   Due to the trouble we were having, we pulled down the source code to see what was going on and what might be causing a problem with the connection closing.  To my surprise, I found the FogBugz connection values hard-coded in the source code. So if you wanted to change them, you would have to re-build JIRA.  Certainly wasn't prepared to go down that direction yet.

This information should be stored either in a cookie, the database, or be configurable value through the web interface, or at least a property.
fields.summary: Connection information is hard-coded in FogBugz importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11773].
  {panel}

Currently, we have an issue security scheme that specifies a security level of "Reporter plus support." Of course, the "Users/Groups" for this level is "Reporter" plus the group of users that comprise the support folks. This has worked really well for us.

Some of our "customers" have more than one user that submits issues, and they would like to see all the issues reported by their "company."

Rather than try to manage this with separate groups (one for each customer, I would like to try this:

We need something like a "Reporter Domain" user/group and when this is specified, security checks would work similar to the "Reporter" user. But instead of comparing the id of the current signed-on user with the id of the reporter of the issue, compare the e-mail domain of the signed-on user with the "reporterdomain" custom field (that is implemented by one of the Atlassian supplied plug-ins) in the issue.

We would like to see this as both an issue security level and as a transition condition.

Clearly the execution code change is very small. The trick is going to be getting this configurable, translated, documented, etc.

A portion of this is already implemented in that we already have the "reporterdomain" field configured. 

Of course, using e-mail for this introduces it's own set of requirements on registration. For example, there needs to be a flag in configuration to require e-mail verification. That is, it should not be possible for someone to register with an e-mail address of tom@mycompany.com and then be able to look at all issues reported by anyone at mycompany.com without at least going through mycompany's e-mail system first.
fields.summary: CLONE -Add "reporter domain" permission

fields.description:
In JIRA 3.7 some javascript functionality will not work in WebLogic and Orion because these App servers apply the servlet filters to normal requests and request forwards. The filter that can cause trouble when applied to request forwards is ProfilingAndErrorFilter. 
The problem is that the filter is trying to do too much. 
The "profiling" part of the filter enables profiling stack if profiling is enabled. 
The "error" part sets up and clears a various thread locals. 
In JIRA 3.7 we use the thread locals to record what javascript files to serve in the request. However if there is a request forward during the request the thread local is cleared and the knowledge of which javascript files must be served is lost. 
The thread local code needs to be taken out into a separate filter which is mapped to all URLS /*. The error filter needs to record a flag in the request object to record if it has been applied to the request already and if so do not do any work. We already use this approach in com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.gzip.GzipFilter
fields.summary: Separate Profiling and Error filters to support WebLogic and Orion

fields.description:
Today the tickets in Jira are named xxx-yyy.

If you run multiple Jiras for scalability or geography, this limits your ability to distinguish multiple Jiras.  The workaround is to select xxx's which are globally unique to an organization, but this would not help if a company acquired another company with Jira.

Instead, the system should let you identify a server with a code, maybe two extra characters, and then tickets would be referenced as 
AA-XXX-YYY.

Perhaps another scheme could be dreamed up to make it even easier since it would be nice not to type extra characters.

Goals:
1. From a ticket, I need to know which server it came from.  
  -For example, fisheye would have to know from the check-in comment.  
  -My other applications need to know so I can visualize the right Jira ticket and URL based on the ticket

Today's workaround:
1. Require administrator to have distinct three letter codes
2. Never acquire a company with Jira, as the three letter codes cannot be changed (in any case, all the check-in comments from the past would be wrong.)
3. Maintain a table which maps the three letter codes to the respective URL for the correct Jira.  That way I can lookup the URL.
4. Don't put a lot of tickets in Jira, and live with one server

This ticket clearly requires considerable discussion.
fields.summary: Ticket numbering scheme should be changed to support multiple Jiras in an organization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11756].
  {panel}

*Example:* I create task and initially estimate it for 2 weeks. After few days I start working on that issue but 2 weeks is too long for single issue, so I divide it to multiple subtasks. If I estimate subtasks subsequently project's estimate will grow artificially because I estimate subtasks having estimated parent task. 
*End of example*

In my view after dividing task into subtasks original estimate of parent task should be 0 and should be calculated from all relevant subtasks. 
Other solution would be not to include estimations from subtasks into the project/release estimation sum. This way after logging work for subtask remaining estimation for parent task should be decremented accordingly.
fields.summary: Original estimate of parent task should be calculated

fields.description:
Hi,

In our JIRA implementation, we are about to import through Jelly, a large number of issues. 
For this import, many of these issues have to progress to their real status (between 6 and 12 status exist depending on concerned workflow).

To do that, I have to generate a set of TransitionWorkflow Tag in Jelly script, for each imported issues.

The problem encountered can be described as follow :
* For example, one issue required to reach the status "MyStatus" following the transitions 10, 20, 30.
* Transitions 10 and 20 contain postFunction which may update some Field or CustomField
* Transition 30 is associated to a screen containing a Field "Timetracking" and "Scheduled Production Date"
* In the normal usage (through Web Interface by the User), these Fields may have been updated through a "Modify" action or during the Transition 30.
* In the import usage (through Jelly), these Fields may have been updated through the previous "CreateIssue" or "AddCustomField" tag.
* And, in both cases, they may have been modified by a Post-Function ...

* In my case, I want assume that the Timetracking has been updated before the Transition 30, then I do not generate any value for it.
{code:xml}<jira:TransitionWorkflow key="TST-10" user="me" workflowAction="10" />
<jira:TransitionWorkflow key="TST-10" user="me" workflowAction="20" />
<jira:TransitionWorkflow key="TST-10" user="me" workflowAction="30" >
   <jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Scheduled Production Date" value="2006-12-12"/>
</jira:TransitionWorkflow>{code}

The problem is that *WorkflowTransitionUtilImpl.progress()* make an update of Fields defined in workflow associated screen, by the value passed in parameters.
* In case of Web Interface usage, theses value are initialize with value in Database, and eventually changed by user enter.
* In case of my Jelly usage, I am not able to provide a value, and then the *Timetracking is updated to Null* .

_The problem occurs with *TimeTracking* in this case, but we may encouter it in many other cases._

In one word, it would be practice to be able to disengage screen constraints in TransitionWorkflow for Jelly Tags.

Rgds
Vincent
fields.summary: Usage Problem with TransitionWorkflow Tag due to WorkflowTransitionUtil  constraints

fields.description:
The problem is that the portlet configuration is stored in the session when lazy loading a portlet. The PortletRenderer stores the config when rendering the dashboard and then when the request makes it out to the LazyLoadingPortletServlet, it retrieves the config and then removes it from the session. This will NPE if you make two requests at the same time. The first request gets the info and removes the session object. The second request can then not find the object in the session and it dies.

One way around this is to pass enough information in the request such that we can just lookup the portlet config from the db. There is no good way of doing this at the moment other than going to the db. Will need the portlet config id and some better mechanism than just grabbing the GV to make this happen.
fields.summary: LazyLoading Portlets (Saved Filters portlet and charting) can NPE when getting two concurrent requests

fields.description:
The problem can be reproduced live on jira.atlassian.com.
1) Open All resolved bugs navigator
2) Add field "Since last comment"
3) Sort by "Since last comment"
4) Try to view any Issue.

Although it does not kill the server I bet it takes lot of CPU.

(original description from support.atlassian.com)
 The problem found in JIRA 3.6.4, 3.6.5 and also 3.7 beta 2.

How to reproduce
1) Put a calculated custom field on IssueNavigator.
2) Open IssueNavigator for large set of issues (in my case 857 is enough)
3) Sort IssueNavigator by the custom field. Sorting works fine, see [^sort_navigator_by_customfield.txt]
4) View arbitrary issue from IssueNavigator. There we have a problem, see [^ViewIssue.txt]

As you can see "Searching and sorting with HitCollector" takes unreasonable amount of time.

As far as I understood, the problem is in NextPrevious list generation:
com/atlassian/jira/web/action/issue/ViewIssue.java doExecute() calls getPagerManager().updatePager(getSearchRequest(), getRemoteUser()); (line 206 in 3.6.4 source)
This method fetches all issue keys from active filter for NextPrevious Pager.
LuceneSearchProvider.SearchAndSort() generates set of "hits" . Afterwards hits are collected.
This line is the deepest level where I dag in : hitCollector.collect(hits.doc). During retrieval of documents (issue Keys) method doc() regularly freezes (something like after every batch of 100 records).

Reindexing does not help.

Sorting by calculated custom fields is very useful. For example sorting by overdue calculated field. We have ~26000 issues in production environment and there is very hi probability for this problem to happen. This problem freezed server by overloading CPU for couple of minutes.

Regards
fields.summary: ViewIssue very slow when issue navigator is sorted by calculated customfield

Error 503--Service Unavailable
From RFC 2068 Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1:
10.5.4 503 Service Unavailable

The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server. The implication is that this is a temporary condition which will be alleviated after some delay. If known, the length of the delay may be indicated in a Retry-After header. If no Retry-After is given, the client SHOULD handle the response as it would for a 500 response.

    Note: The existence of the 503 status code does not imply that a server must use it when becoming overloaded. Some servers may wish to simply refuse the connection.

fields.description:
At the moment when viewing a particular user's role membership, the screen shows a tick if the user is directly associated with a role or a cross, if the user is not *directly* associated with a role.

If the user is associated with a role through a group (but not directly), then the group (or groups) name(s) is shown in brackets, but the shown icon is a cross. If the user is directly associated with a role and through a group the icon is a tick, and the groups are shown in brackets.

Showing a cross if the user is associated with a role through a group (or groups) is confusing. I think the behaviour should be:

# If the user is a member of the role through a group (and not directly) show a 'group' icon (we need to find a good group icon, currently we do not have one). In this case, do not show a cross. Show the group names (leave this behaviour as is). The only thing that changes is that instead of a cross we show a group icon.
# If the user is a member of a role through a group (or groups) and directly. Show both the tick and the group icons. List group names as is done now. The only thing that changes is that we will show the group icon as well as the tick icon.
# User is directly associated with a role but not through any groups. Show a tick as is done now. No changes required for this use case.

To navigate to the page that shows users role membership go to Administration -> User Browser -> Select a user -> Click View Project Roles
fields.summary: Show a group icon when viewing user roles for a user

fields.description:
When exporting data from support.atlassian.com, the export fails with an OutOfMemoryException.  This is due to the large number of records in the notificationinstance table ( more than 1.4 million).  Tests were carried out using both the PostgreSQL JDBC2 and JDBC3 drivers.  

The root cause of this problem is the large number of records in the notificationinstance table.  This is caused by the javamail api not providing an easy way to set the message-id (to something unique like jira.atlassian.com/JRA-11345).  Instead we currently use and record the unique message ID generated by the mail server to thread e-mail in JIRA.  There is however a workaround for this problem [here|http://java.sun.com/products/javamail/FAQ.html#msgid].  Once this gets implemented, we can get rid of the notificationinstance table all together.

h3. Workaround

For normal backups, disabling the XML backup and replacing it with native backups is an effective strategy.

If upgrading, rather than using an XML export it is possible to use a backup of the database generated by the DBMS. For example:

# Create a database backup using the native DB tools ([for example mysqldump|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/using-mysqldump.html] in MySQL).
# Create a new database and restore that backup into it.
# Point the new JIRA instance to that database by either modifying the {{dbconfig.xml}} or using the [JIRA Configuration Tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool].
# Start up the new instance - it will perform upgrade tasks on the database similar to if an XML backup was imported.

The only side effect of this is it will use the schema from the backed up database - if the schema changes in later versions and we don't have upgrade tasks to modify that schema there may be minor problems such as documented in [JIRA 4.0 Database Schema Changes for MySQL and Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.0+Database+Schema+Changes+for+MySQL+and+Oracle]. This only applies if upgrading from particularly old version such as 3.13.x and lower and can be corrected as in that documentation.
fields.summary: Exporting data from a JIRA instance with a lot records in the notificationinstance table causes an OutOfMemoryException

fields.description:
It should *never* be possible to delete the Default Permission Scheme.

The reason for this is that a project cannot be created without a Permission Scheme.

So if the Default Permission Scheme is not used, and the Bulk Delete Scheme Tool is used to delete the Default Permission Scheme, then all projects and all other permission schemes are deleted, it will not be possible to create a new project. A new permission scheme would need to be created before creating a new project.

The above scenario is unlikely, but we should still fix this problem.
fields.summary: Bulk Delete Scheme Tool allows to delete the Default Permission Scheme

fields.description:
I imported data from Bugzilla and forgot to map a custom status to anything in Jira. That's a problem with the importer, that it doesn't disallow that. The subsequent problem is tthat running the Admin, Ingegrity Checker and selecting just "Check jira issues with null status" causes the checker itself to die. From the trace below, I believe that the problem is with the line below, where an assumption is made that the genericValue.getInteger() returns non-null, which is not true in this case.

com/atlassian/jira/appconsistency/integrity/check/WorkflowIssueStatusNull.java:132
            StepDescriptor step = workflow.getDescriptor().getStep(genericValue.getInteger("stepId").intValue());
            if(step == null)
                throw new IllegalStateException("Can not resolve a step with id: " + genericValue.getInteger("stepId") + " from workflow " + workflow.getName());

fields.description:
My company outsources our email service and the system requires "POP before SMTP" while JIRA seems to only support authenticated (or non-authenticated) smtp.

I have seen a few posts about this on the forum and in your defect tracking system (JRA-9265, JRA-2310) but the people reporting the issue seemed to have control over their email server.  It would definitely be helpful for us to be able to check a box on the JIRA mail server configuration screne that causes JIRA do a quick POP request prior to dealing with its outbound email.

I thought about setting up the issue/comment creation feature of JIRA that does use POP with the hope that those would fire frequently enough to ensure the "POP before SMTP" is statisfied, but since that service is decoupled from the Mail Queue Service, it seemed like a fragile solution.

Below are the relevant lines from the log of "Send a Test Mail".  As shown in the DEBUG lines below, I do have authenticated SMTP set up, but that doesn't seem sufficient for my email provider.  I have put in a request for the IP of my JIRA deployment to be added to a "trusted IP" list on our mail server for relaying, but since the service is outside of my control, I don't know if it will go through.

An error has occurred with sending the test email:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-11699].
  {panel}

Hello,

When adding a comment to an issue, it would be great if we could specify a user instead of a group for the comment's visibility.

We are using Jira as an helpdesk system and it is often necessary to communicate passwords. If we could set the visibility of the comment to the reporter only, it will be more secure.

Thanks,
Cécile
fields.summary: Comments Visibility - Possibility to specify a user instead of a group

fields.description:
Currently, if a non-default locale setting is used in JIRA, the client will not be able to tell the correct value for the date field. e.g.

{noformat}com.atlassian.jira.util.SimpleErrorCollection = {com.atlassian.jira.util.SimpleErrorCollection@5890}"Errors: 
{duedate=你没有输入一个合法的日期,请按照 \"d/MMM/yy\" 格式输入日期..}\nError Messages: []"{noformat}

Unless, JIRA is able to provide a set of possible values extracted out from the localized {{java.text.DateFormatSymbols}}.
fields.summary: Date format to be locale-insensitive

fields.description:
When using subtasks as a detailing level of main issues devs often forget that remaining estimate for both are included in reports and stats. This may lead to significant errors in time reporting on a project.

Possible solution is to be able to configure an issue type to "Aggregate (and override) time of subtasks if present".
fields.summary: Be able to aggregate subtask estimate figures to master issue

fields.description:
There is a mistake in the file "JiraWebActionSupport_fr.properties" which is available on this page : http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/translations/ (Last updated: Wed Dec 6 02:02:31 EST 2006).

"issue.field.updated = Mise è jour le" sould be "issue.field.updated = Mise à jour le" ("à" instead of "è")
The translation is correct in the file provided by Richard THIBAULT here : http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3053 .


There is also something strange with "common.concepts.today = Aujourd''hui". In JIRA, it shows two quotes, when it should show only one. I added a screenshot to show the problem.

I also think that "issue.column.heading.fixversions = Versions ciblées" suits better JIRA than "issue.column.heading.fixversions = Corrigé dans".

Olivier
fields.summary: Typos in the French translation

fields.description:
We use jira to track issues that sometimes needs an action set in the future.
It would be very useful if an e-mail was sent out to the person assigned to the jira issue when the set due date passed. Or at least if it was possible to configurat it in that way.

Regards
Mattias Lindberg
Labs2

fields.description:
At the moment if the CSV file is badly formatted the import dies with unfriendly error messages. We should try to, at least, detect some most common error conditions and see if we can present better error messages.

For example, if " (double quote) characters are not escaped with 2 double quite characters (""). Not sure how difficult this is to do.

fields.description:
After reading the (usually lengthy) comments on an issue, I have to scroll back up to the top to click Add Comment. 

Most websites put an 'add comment' link at the bottom so it's there when you want to use it.

In a related matter, there's no indication of the 'Add Comment' access key, which is apparently 'm'. You should have a title on the link or underline the letter to indicate that.
fields.summary: Put an 'Add comment' link at the bottom of the page.

fields.description:
If the Default Field Configuration or any other Field Configuration is copied via the *Copy* link under *Operations* and is then edited both the copied and the original field configuration show these changes instead of just the copied one.

To re-produce on s.a.c:
1. Copy the Default Field Configuration
2. Configure the copied Field Config by adding the Default Screen to field Time in Status
3. Click on View All Field Configurations
4. Click on Configure for the Default Field Configuration

*Results*
The Default Field Configuration has the change made the copied Field Configuration

*Notes*
- I also tried this for the Recruitment Field Config.
- If the Default Field Configuration is then changed back to its original state then these changes are also shown in the copied Field Configuration
fields.summary: Copying a Field Configuration then editing its screens results in both the copied and original Field Configuration being edited

fields.description:
When editing an issue with only one issue type, the issuetype field is fixed to the current issuetype and displays the following message:
{noformat}
There are no issue types with compatible field configuration and/or workflow associations.
The issue type can only be changed by _moving_ this issue.
{noformat}
where _moving_ is a link to move the current issue.

The message above is hidden if the user does not have the 'move issue' permission, however if the user has the permission and only one project exists, the link is still displayed.

The move issue page does not display properly and displays the wrong error message ("You do not have the permissions required to browse any projects").
fields.summary: Shows move link in edit issue page even when theres only one project
Can delete last standard/subtask issuetype in professional, which causes System error

fields.description:
Is it possible to adjust Navigator column widths?

What we need is a way of re-sizing the column widths in the issue navigator, similar to the way it can be done in Excel using the mouse (i.e. hold mouse over a column separator and drag it left or right as required). It appears that when you add & remove columns using the 'configure issue navigator' & 'set filter columns' the column widths are automatically set by the system - we want to be able to adjust these.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator columns need to be adjustable for width

fields.description:
Theres a new safe {{requestContext}} available in velocity contexts to get the context path as opposed to using the {{req}} (Request) object directly.

Usages of {{$req.contextPath}} should be replaced by {{$requestContext.baseUrl}}
fields.summary: Use the new '$requestContext.baseUrl' instead of '$req.contextPath' in velocity

Display issue constant icons consistantly

fields.description: There is a bug in Opera 9 and 9.0.1 that is fixed in Opera 9.0.2 in the way that it handles an Ajax request that gets returned a redirect. Instead of following the redirect it returns with empty content and a status of 302. In the charting plugin popup when you click the view button from the configure page this starts an Ajax request that relies on a redirect to fill the div with new content. This will not work in Opera 9 and 9.0.1. You will need to upgrade your version of Opera if you want to use this functionality under opera.
fields.summary: Charting plugin search request view popup does not work correctly with Opera 9.0.1

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Do not log in 
# Browse a project
# Create a pie chart

The configuration page then shows one dropdown for "Statistic type".  A Filter dropdown should also be present, but it is silently absent as you are not logged in.

The unwitting user clicks "Next" with no error or warning, and may believe he is stuck in a infinitely long wizard, thus wasting the rest of his/her valuable life.
fields.summary: Not Logged In User -  The Pie Chart Report does not pass the first step

fields.description:
Currently, you can set up a portlet to display Project Statistics, which draws bars for a quick glance to see how one particular stat of a project.

In the Project portlet (full view), you get a color-coded bar for Priority settings of open tickets with handy mouse-over tooltips for getting the exact numbers of each color.

What would be handy would be a way to display the Two Dimentional Filter Statistics portlet with color-coded bars as used in the Project portlet, such that it resembles the Project Statistics portlet.

Example: I want the statistics for Status (Open, Closed, etc), but I also want to know at a glance how many are of severe priority, critical, etc. Project Statistics gives me the bars, but they're not color coded, and Two Dimentional Filter Statistics gives me the numbers, but not the at-a-glance convenience of bar graphs.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics with bar graph
